headline: Entrepreneur ‚Ä¢ Kinda Famous On The Internet ‚Ä¢ Still A Lean Guy At Heart
company_full_address: Waukesha, US
company_description:
In 2019, I used my layoff from GE as an opportunity to transform my life.  One aspect of that was through moving to a low carb lifestyle, which has resulted in me losing over 70 lbs and getting off of blood pressure medication for the first time in two decades.  I also tapped into my passion for training and cooking to create SeriousKeto.

Since then, SeriousKeto has become one of the top 1/2 of 1% of ALL YouTube channels and has over 200K social media subscribers/followers.  On any given day, my content is viewed by 20K to 30K individuals, as I share recipes, motivation and inspiration to people who want to take control of their health naturally.

It's been so rewarding to get comments, messages and emails daily from my followers, thanking me for helping them lose weight, conquer diabetes, eliminate inflammation, and get off of prescription medications.  I also get the opportunity to fight the immense amounts of misinformation propagated by the media, big food, and big pharma about the many health benefits of a low carb lifestyle.

Love has many forms, which is a beautiful gift. But, this can also create confusion and conflict if we are unaware of both our own connection to this amazing energy and other's expressions of it.

Understanding how to utilize love as a means to support our personal health and wellness, build more connected and meaningful relationships with family and friends, and support our communities can be a unique journey. 

This is where Suivera can assist. No matter where an individual is on their journey of love, Suivera has resources to assistance.

From self-love, to building stronger relationships with family and friends through love, to witnessing how these connections with self and others build the foundation for healthier communities - Suivera is there to help each individual as we embark upon this worldwide movement of love.

company_description:
Neal Schaffer created his social media strategy consultancy Windmills Marketing DBA NealSchaffer.com and PDCA Social to fill a gap that brands and companies have between their willingness to effectively implement social media throughout their organization and their ability to do so. Neal believed the answer to this problem is two-fold: 1) Many companies simply lacked the experience of working deeply with social media platforms and/or were not maximizing the full functionality they provided and 2) Companies lack a strategy and structure for which to govern the everyday activities of their social efforts and tie it in with the ROI for whatever strategic corporate objective they have. Neal, therefore, created a unique and completely proprietary social media strategy consulting program which, combined with his social media coaching and training, has helped dozens of companies better leverage and strategically utilize social media for a variety of objectives, including marketing, sales, business development, customer service, reputation management, and crisis management. The proprietary framework and process used to develop a social media strategy forms the basis of Neal's book Maximize Your Social.

Neal's firm provides the following social media consulting services:

Social Media Strategy Consulting

company_description:
SearchRPM.com is an SEO consulting team in Austin, TX that's at the epicenter of the online ecosystem. Company founder Michael Ramirez recognized the need for a different kind of SEO company shortly after landing his first job at an interactive advertising agency.

Having received a Degree in Advertising from The University of Texas at Austin, he quickly realized that many standard SEO practices went against the traditional lessons of marketing ‚Äì essentially giving the customers what they wanted, when they wanted it and how they wanted it.

So Michael set about creating a new approach that provided tangible SEO results without sacrificing the customer experience. And the new approach worked.

With each campaign Michael implemented, measured and evolved the approach, applying traditional marketing principles and strategies to the world of SEO. After getting consistently exceptional results for local, national and international clients in a variety of industries, it became clear. Online advertising in the hands of a creative marketing mind was far superior to the standard SEO strategies that solely targeted search results.

This evolution of traditional and modern marketing is now the basis of SearchRPM.

With a presence in over 50 countries, TBF offers in-person and online programs tailored to people from all walks of life. Our certification pathway is structured to ensure that facilitators undergo their own healing process, making them more effective in guiding others through the same. Our programs include:

-Introductory courses for personal wellness
-Facilitator training and certification programs
-Online resources for ongoing learning and support
-International events and retreats

Led by our founder, Dr. Judith Kravitz, and a team of Senior Trainers, TBF has transformed the lives of thousands worldwide. We are committed to advancing the field of breathwork and supporting our community in leading healthier, more connected lives.

Consistently described as "the best speaker we've ever had," John's emotional story-telling, unexpected humor, and authenticity make each of his presentations, experiences, episodes and interactions truly transformational.

company_description:
As with our namesake, we're a bit more aggressive than most are used to in an agency partner.  We're okay with that. We believe that the modern agency needs to live the strategy we suggest to our clients. Authenticity. If we think you are doing it wrong, we'll tell you. We'll argue with you. It's the only way to make sure we are doing it right. Be passionate. If we don't believe in the work, we'll be honest and suggest you find someone else.

If we don't believe in every piece of work we do, how can we bring that to your community? It's our mission to align ourselves with the right clients, that we can be successful for. Don't expect soft results either. We know you have one job. Sell stuff (see website - LI made us change that word).  It doesn't matter what department you are in. It's one business and one goal. Sell product.

Ultimately you work for a company that needs to sell their products. We get that.

If you are being told it's about ‚Äòlikes' or ‚Äòviews' or ‚Äògo viral, it's bull and you need a new partner. 

It's about selling your products.  We know that with the right social strategy, the right content to fulfill that strategy, and the analytics to measure it, that we'll test, iterate and ultimately use your budget with the greatest efficiency on the right channels and drive the awareness, growth and ultimately sales that your product or business needs.

Do you still think that TV and Banner ads are going to do the trick with the same efficiency and effectiveness? It won't. We'll prove it.

company_description:
The profitability of companies has less to do with the amount spent on R&D and more with the level of company-wide innovation. Innovative companies enjoy higher profits when they introduce new products and services, before competition occurs, experience higher market share, and sustain consistent high profits over time because they continue to deliver new products and services ahead of their competitors. Research showed that market shares of innovators were 3 times higher, sales were 6 times higher, and EBIT Margins were 10% better than average companies. During recession, these margins could be 50% better than average. Over time, the profitability of innovative companies was 35% to 80% better than non-innovative companies. 

Our starting point is that all employees are capable of high degrees of creativity, and that the organization restricts that creativity due its culture. Hiring more creative people or acquiring companies with innovative products or services is not as effective as increasing the level of creativity with the existing employees to their potential. The process includes the creation of creativity-supportive environment, individual creativity training, team and team leader processes, and finally effective implementation mechanism to turn creative ideas into innovative products, services, and processes.

company_description:
At The Wee Coaching Company, we are a small team with a big mission: to enable children and young people's mental strength and resilience. Founded and run by Scottish twin sisters working in education and health, we are dedicated to positively impacting the lives of young people and the caring adults around them.
We believe every child and young person has the potential to thrive, and our goal is to help unlock that potential. Through our specialised coaching programs and services, we work closely with children and young people to build their confidence, develop emotional resilience, and equip them with the tools they need to navigate life's challenges. Our approach is nurturing, strengths-based, and grounded in a deep understanding of the unique needs of each individual we work with.
Our mission doesn't stop with the young people themselves. We recognise the vital role parents, teachers, tutors, mentors, and coaches play in developing children and young people. We also offer tailored support for these caring adults, providing them with the skills, strategies, and insights needed to foster a positive and supportive environment. By empowering those closest to the child, we create a network of resilience that extends far beyond our coaching sessions.
Our twin founders bring a unique blend of expertise and passion to The Wee Coaching Company. With their rich backgrounds in education and health, they have crafted a holistic approach that combines professional knowledge with a personal touch. They are committed to creating a warm, welcoming space where everyone feels valued and understood.
We aim to empower one million children with the knowledge, skills, and tools to lead calm, happy, and fulfilling lives tailored to their aspirations. Understanding the scale of this mission, we recognise that it cannot be accomplished alone. We invite caring, curious, and empathetic individuals who resonate with our mission to join us

company_description:
Flair is a newly launched virtual showcasing platform and marketplace for fashion graduates and the next generation of designers with an emphasis on brand storytelling. Helping customers to discover, connect and shop directly from emerging and innovative brands, while utilising technology such as augmented reality to bring those stories to life.

Flair's aim is to empower designers, calling for a transformation to the traditional e-commerce marketplace. Born out of the need of fashion graduates and emerging brands to showcase their creative concepts and sell online without the hassle of running an e-commerce website, Flair is set up to be the connector, supporter and innovator.

The new generation of fashion is graduating with powerful values and strong concepts that are often lost in traditional spheres. Instead of seeing passions as something to control, Flair focuses on the necessity of empowering these stories. In fact, they see inviting the customer into the creative sphere of the young designer as a necessary connection point.

We developed Flair from the ground up, using cutting edge web technologies and augmented reality, to be used as tools, giving brands flexibility to tell their story and create unique virtual experiences while exploring new media. Furthermore, Flair's future roadmap outlines key areas of technical development and collaboration with technology partners to introduce exciting, enriched, online shopping experiences.

At the backend, Flair is also supporting its designers by connecting them to the wider industry through an ecosystem of services within the supply chain - helping designers find fairer practices, scale production and reduce cost.

company_description:
Touchtight Coaching was created in 2016, with the hope to create content that would support coaches and players in their development. Time and prioritisation is a crucial factor when it comes to personal development and by failing to manage it, we can often become overwhelmed with our day to day. 

For this reason, we created an online platform the provides animated content for coaches and players that would save them time and inspire individuals to be creative in their work. By producing practices, sessions, formations and tactical solutions that can be applied to all age groups and adapted to meet player's needs has been our aim. 

As the platform has grown and we have seen the influence on coaches and player's worldwide we have listened to users and attempted to create a platform that meets user needs.

1. New App developed for IOS and Android for Mobile and Tablet
2. Developed a new, quicker platform at app.touchtight.com with better search and filter options

We have listened to questions from many coaches about how we can support clubs and create videos themselves and so just to say without giving too much away, "We are listening!"

Right, I hope that gives you some understanding of Touchtight. My name is Leon and I played Semi Pro for over 10 years (not quite good enough), was a teacher for many years (for my sins) and now an A Licence Coach (does that mean much now?!). My biggest advice is to prioritise every single day and manage your time wisely and focus on making a positive difference wherever, whenever and however you can.

company_full_address: 249 a Ladypool Road Sparkbrook Birmingham, Birmingham, B12 8LF, GB
keywords: group therapy, holistic based therapy, group exercise, community support worker, mental health education, talking therapies, mental health, holistic therapy, exercise classes, mental well-being, community support, psychological wellness, physical activity, mental fitness, therapeutic approach, cognitive behavioral therapy, wellness programs, mental health awareness, exercise for mental health, support services, self-care, therapy sessions, outdoor activities, mindfulness practices, trauma recovery, stress management, mental health initiatives, nhs alternatives, lifestyle coaching, emotional support, community wellness, personal development, mental health recovery, collaboration, research studies, peer support, fitness professionals, meditation, resilience building, mental health podcasts, mental health resources, mental health services, adaptive fitness, social connections, trauma-informed care, support groups, well-being workshops, mental health advocacy, healthcare partnerships, exercise for anxiety, mental health education programs, hospital & health care
company_description:
Discussing Mental Health is a beacon of hope in the world of mental well-being.

Inspiration and Mission: This journey began with a deep-rooted frustration over the inadequate support available for those struggling with mental health issues. Waiting times were unacceptably long, and private therapy was often financially out of reach. But instead of simply lamenting these challenges, we decided to be a force for change. Our mission was to provide a lifeline for those suffering in silence.

A Personal Journey: The connection to mental health wasn't merely professional. It was deeply personal. CEO and Founder Stephanie Bashford's path to recovery included the integration of exercise, and she passionately shared her experiences through the "Discussing Mental Health" podcast. The project took a poignant turn during the pandemic when Stephanie lost her younger brother to medication prescribed for his mental health conditions. This heartbreaking event fueled her commitment to helping others who faced similar struggles. Stephanie was determined to make a difference.

A Unique Approach: "Discussing Mental Health" is not just another mental health initiative. It's a fresh, unique, and innovative combination of talking therapy and exercise. This approach offers a holistic way to address mental well-being, recognising the undeniable link between physical activity and mental health.

Community Impact: The ultimate vision is to make mental health support accessible to as many citizens as possible.

company_full_address: Upper Bray Rd, Sherwood Studios, Maidenhead, Berkshire SL6 2DA, GB
company_description:
Why did we open a music recording and podcast studio in Maidenhead? My name is Tarun Puri and I am the owner and founder of Sherwood Studios.

"My passion for music came from being sat in a recording session many years ago, watching my sister perform a demo of one of her songs at the time. The concept of being able to create something from nothing, whilst telling your own story is something special because music can be extremely powerful, in helping you find your own identity which can be hard for young people in todays society. There is a constant pressure to compare yourself with others on social media, which can be harmful in focusing on your own journey and development. Sherwood Studios provides a space, where your artistic growth and peace of mind is our primary concern". 

Tarun has been making music for over five years, amassing over four million streams on Spotify alone. Having a strong support network really helped Tarun in building a loyal fan base. This is something that Sherwood Studios wants to emphasise, birthing its very own creative community in Maidenhead. In fact, there is a lot of talent in Maidenhead and its surrounding areas that is ready to be developed and elevated. That's why the team had such an appetite to open a studio in Maidenhead. Tarun's music has given him the platform to work alongside a number of different charities, such as Young Minds, Child Bereavement UK and Cardiac Risk in the Young. From this, they raised over ¬£5000 in the process. Sherwood Studios believes that music and video production should always tell a story. We are dedicated to telling your story.

We feel blessed to be able to work with such talented creatives in the music and podcast space, as we feel part of their journey. It's very important to us that we create an experience and a product that is bespoke, tailored to each individual and their specific requirements. 

The team is now constantly growing & we can't wait to see what the future holds for us.

company_description:
We are Libera. A bilingual creative digital agency based in Wales. Our mission is to empower brands with the confidence to know that their digital marketing is driving real results. We are committed to providing creative and data-driven strategies that exceed expectations.

What do we offer? So glad you asked...

‚Ä¢ Paid social and search
People hate ads, right? Wrong. People hate *bad* ads. You know, the kind that disrupts your experience as you're happily scrolling away. The decline of organic reach across platforms has led to a need to invest in advertising budgets. Ads is kind of our thing. We can fully manage your paid social or paid search ads to reach your goals, whether that's to amplify your brand awareness, drive traffic to your website, or boost sales and conversions.

‚Ä¢ Training and cosultancy
Social media and digital marketing move fast. It can be a challenge to keep up. Where do you start? With 15 years in the field between us, we've been there, done that, got several t-shirts. We can work with your internal teams, deliver tailored training sessions or provide full audits of your social media accounts with actionable pointers to reach your goals.

‚Ä¢ Content and creative
Sick of churning out content without knowing if any of it is actually effective? Yeah, we've been there. From keeping on top of trends, working with influencers and creators for your brand, to making sure content is correctly optimised for maximum impact, we can help you with a creative strategy fit for 2023.

We look forward to working with you!
